ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 6-8 hours depending on the assignment. Sometimes a bit more or less.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: More details and contents need to covered.

This course was a good introduction to the theory of survival analysis. The weekly homework assignments helped keep students engaged in the material without being overwhelming. In future years, the course might benefit from a little more organization in the structure and presentation of the lectures.

Strengths: - The class focused on learning of concepts and tested us on that as opposed to more complicated tricks. - The weekly HW assignments were manageable and helped in understanding the class material.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Daniel Zelterman  Prof. Zelterman is amazing! He is a terrific instructor and a great lecturer.
Instructor: Daniel Zelterman  Professor Zelterman was an excellent instructor who took the time to carefully and clearly explain all concepts.

Instructor: Daniel Zelterman  Prof. Zelterman is very friendly and approachable and explained the concepts very well. He focused on the students' learning and explained concepts in more detail or in different ways from the text book which made it useful to understand.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: the textbook is informative, and I wish if the instructor have covered more than he arranged
This is a good and important course. Yes, I would recommend it.
